thread.title: EXCLUSIVE: Former Prem star reveals why Chelsea still have the edge over Liverpool
thread.title_full: EXCLUSIVE: Former Prem star reveals why Chelsea still have the edge over Liverpool

title: EXCLUSIVE: Former Prem star reveals why Chelsea still have the edge over Liverpool
text:
GETTY David James reckons Chelsea have the edge over Liverpool 
The Blues sit top of the pile   despite a disappointing 2-0 defeat to Tottenham last night. 
They remain five points ahead of second placed Liverpool with half the season gone. 
But James reckons Jurgen Klopp's men need to plug their leaky defence if they want to catch their title rivals. Chelsea's expected XI to face Peterborough in the FA Cup Thursday, 5th January 2017 CHELSEA host Peterborough in the FA Cup on Sunday afternoon - but who will play? 1 / 13 Chelsea (Odds: 1/7 to win, 13/2 to draw, 16/1 to lose) “David James reckons Chelsea have the edge over Liverpool” 
" Chelsea still look more formidable because of their defence rather than their goalscoring prowess," he said. 
"My concern for Liverpool prior to Simon Mignolet getting his place back is the clean sheets. 
"It sounds very simple in one way, that clean sheets win you matches. 
"Liverpool conceding goals has generally been a bit of a problem. 
GETTY Antonio Conte's Chelsea lost to Tottenham yesterday 
"But the thing is, Liverpool are going to score goals." 
Liverpool and Chelsea are both in FA Cup action on Sunday. 
The Reds face Plymouth at Anfield on Sunday and Antonio Conte's men will lock horns with Peterborough at Stamford Bridge. Related articles
